course.title: PSY 4327 Sleep and Dreams (3 units)
course.desc: Sleep and dreams in the context of physiology and psychological adaptation. Functions of sleep. Sleep disorders and their treatment. Theories of dream functions. Dreams, health, personality and consciousness. Course includes laboratory activities (e.g., sleep-lab experiment or dream analysis lab).Course Component: LecturePrerequisites: PSY 1101, PSY 1102, PSY 2301, and 54 university units. Reserved for students registered in the Major, Joint Honours and Honours programs in psychology.
